CatDescriptText: Partial cutline of related image published in Flash Newspicture Magazine, November 1, 1938, pg. 7, reads: "Negro Representatives in Big Business - Jesse Owens, center, above, is proud of his capacity as Ohio representative for the Calvert Distilleries... Owens, since his great European exploits in track and field has delved into many things from politics to matching strides with a race horse for a winner's purse.  Jesse seems to be pleased with his latest fling at regular employment with the Calvert people; the job appears to be more of less regular and from all indications, the Calvert firm is fortunate in securing a representative so popular and appealing to millions of sepias everywhere."Owens won four Olympic Gold Medals at the 1936 Olympic games in Berlin in 100-meter dash, the 200-meter dash, the broad jump, and the 400-meter relay team.  In the background, the tail of an airplane, with its registration number NC 13359, is visible.
TitMainTitle: Two men, including Jesse Owens on left, with two boys and male onlookers at Allegheny County Airport
